page.title: 11KIPPILAW HOUSE
page.content: {Kippilaw House}is a large composite house with 20-25 rooms, a substantial listed building. The land once belonged to the monks. Records can be traced back to 1795. One feature of special interest is the fine Regency mantlepiece of pine with stucco enrichment. {It is}far too big for comfortable living today, one problem being the lack of staff. There are five cottages on the estate formerly occupied by gardeners and chauffeurs etc. Now a flat in the mansion and a cottage are both empty. One cottage is owned and occupied by a retired teacher, another by a college lecturer and another by a mason. { {Race Horse Breeding.}The present owner devotes much of her time to breeding horses very successfully. She does not train horses.
